issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Wahram IV on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with mural element, crescent above forehead; covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below the korymbos, pointing upwards; pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing below ball of hair, pointing upwards; earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with a row of pearls; floral elements bwlow bust; double row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast ornament (only upper part visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy l'mštl yzdklty MRKAn MRKA 'nyr'n W 'yr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay rāmšahr Yazdgerd šāhān šāh  Ērān ud kē čihr az yazdān|"The Mazda-worshiping divine Yazdgerd, who brings peace to his realm; King of Kings of the Iranians and non-Iranians, whose seeds/splendour is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; on the shaft l'st (rāst, "just"); to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar slabs; alter flames, rendered by three tiers of four, three and two strokes respectively; to the left and right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Yazdgerd I, holding a barsom with both hands, dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 3 h l.i. yzdklty, 9 h l. o. l'sty| Yazdgerd rāst| "Yazdgerd the Just"
